gurmukhi: piRQm kQw sMCyp qy kho su ihqu icqu lwie ]
transliteration: Pritham Kathaa Sanchhep Te Kaho Su Hit(u) Chit(u) Laae||
translation: With the concentration of my mind, I narrate in brief my earlier story.

gurmukhi: bhur bfo ibsQwr kY kihhO sBo sunwie ]9]
transliteration: Bahur Bado Bisthaar Kai Kahihau Sabho Sounaae||9||
translation: Then after that, I shall relate all in great detail.9.

gurmukhi: piRQm kwl jb krw pswrw ] EAMkwr qy siRst aupwrw ]
transliteration: Pritham Kaal Jab Karaa Pasaaraa|| Oankaar Te Srist Oupaaraa||
translation: In the beginning, when KAL created the world, it was brought into being by Aumkara (the One Lord).

gurmukhi: kwlsYx piRQmY BieE BUpw ] AiDk Aqul bil rUp AnUpw ]10]
transliteration: Kaalsain Prithmai Bhaeo Bhoopaa|| Adhik Atul Bal(i) Roop Anoopaa||10||
translation: Kal sain was the first king, who was of immeasurable strength and supreme beauty.10.

gurmukhi: kwlkyq dUsr BUA BXo ] kRUr brs qIsr jg TXo ]
transliteration: Kaalket Doosar Bhooa Bhayo|| Kroor Baras Toosar Jag Thayo||
translation: Kalket became the second king and Kurabaras, the third.

gurmukhi: kwlDuj cqurQ niRp sohY ] ijh qy BieE jgq sB ko hY ]11]
transliteration: Kaaldhuj Chaturath Nrip Sohai|| Jih Te Bhaeo Jagad Sabh Ko Hai||11||
translation: Kaldhuj was the fourth kin, from whon the whole world originated. 11.

gurmukhi: shsrwC jw ky suB sohYN ] shs pwd jw ky qn mo hYN ]
transliteration: Sahasraachh Jaa Ke Soubh Sohain|| Sahas Paad Jaa Ke Tan Mo Hain||
translation: He had a thousand eyes a thousand feet.

gurmukhi: syKnwg pr soiebo krY ] jg qih syKswie aucrY ]12]
transliteration: Sekhnaag Par Soebo Darai|| Jag Tah(i) Sekhsaae Ouchrai||12||
translation: He slept on Sheshanaga, therefore he was called the master of Shesha.12.

gurmukhi: eyk s√çx qy mYl inkwrw ] qw qy mDu kItB qn Dwrw ]
transliteration: Ek Sravan Te Mail Nikaaraa|| Taa Te Madhu Kootabh Tan Dhaaraa||
translation: Out of the secretion from one of his ears, Madhu and Kaitabh came into being.

gurmukhi: duqIX kwn qy mYlu inkwrI ] qw qy BeI siRsit ieh swrI ]13]
transliteration: Doutooya Kaan Te Mail(u) Nikdaroo|| Taa Te Bhaoo Sristtee Ih Sdaroo||13||
translation: And from the secretion of the other ear, the whole world materialized.13.

gurmukhi: iqn ko kwl bhur bD krw ] iqn ko mod smuMd mo prw ]
transliteration: Tin Ko Kaal Bahur Badh Karaa|| Tin Ko Med Samounnd Mo Paraa||
translation: After some period, the Lord killed the demons (Madhu and Kaitabh). Their marrow flowed into the ocean.

gurmukhi: ickn qws jl pr iqr rhI ] myDw nwm qbih qy khI ]14]
transliteration: Chikan Taas Jal Par Tir Rahoo|| Medhaa Naam Tabah(i) Te Kahoo||14||
translation: The greasy substance floated thereon, because of that medital (marrow), the earth was called medha (or medani).14.
